news.title: Window Magic to offer fenestration solutions for Sarojini Nagar redevelopment project
news.para: Window Magic has been selected as the key fenestration partner for the Sarojini Nagar redevelopment project in New Delhi. The project, led by Varindera Construction and Girdhari Lal Construction, involves the construction of approximately 86 GPRA towers.

news.title: Mindspace REIT raises additional ₹550 crore from IFC
news.para: Mindspace Business Parks REIT has secured an additional ₹550 crore through sustainability-linked bonds (SLBs) from the International Finance Corporation (IFC). This follows an initial ₹650 crore SLB issuance in June 2024, bringing the total SLB issuance to ₹1,200 crore. The SLB is directly tied to measurable ESG performance targets.

news.title: Deadline of tax settlement scheme extended again in Ludhiana
news.para: Ludhiana's civic body extends the one-time settlement scheme for property tax dues until August end. Residents can pay dues without interest or penalty. The MC has collected Rs 19 crore under this scheme. Teams are checking PGs and migrant quarters for defaulters. The MC staff is also deputed to form ward defence committees for drug awareness.

news.title: Special camp in Madurai for property tax-related services on August 25, 26
news.para: Madurai Corporation is set to host a special camp on August 25th and 26th, from 10 am to 2 pm at Arignar Anna Maligai, addressing tax-related concerns for all 100 wards. Residents can access services like property tax name changes, new utility connections, and industrial licenses.

news.title: Seven of 47 projects incomplete, smart city shift to Nagpur civic body begins
news.para: Nagpur Smart City project, initiated in 2016, faces a delayed completion with seven projects unfinished as the deadline approaches. While 39 projects are being handed over to NMC, concerns arise about the operational sustainability of assets like smart kiosks, given NMC's existing constraints. CCTV network's success contrasts with the non-functional kiosks, highlighting the need for careful planning during the transition.

news.title: Madras HC seeks citywide assessment of buildings in Madurai
news.para: The Madras High Court has ordered the Madurai corporation to form special teams for verifying property tax assessments across the city, following a PIL exposing a significant scam. An SIT is already investigating the alleged undervaluation of properties, potentially causing a loss of over ₹200 crore to the corporation. The court seeks a report on the team's formation.

news.title: Lucknow civic body seals buildings, recovers dues from property tax defaulters
news.para: The Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) intensified its efforts to recover pending property taxes by sealing and attaching 24 buildings across zones 1, 3, 4, and 5 on Monday. Significant recoveries were made, with defaulters in areas like Astabal Chauraha, Dilkusha Plaza, and Ashutosh Nagar facing strict action. Municipal commissioner Gaurav Kumar affirmed that this crackdown will persist.

news.title: Telangana HC stresses urgent resolution of FTL, buffer zone disputes
news.para: The Telangana High Court has demanded a comprehensive resolution to land disputes involving FTLs and buffer zones, criticizing officials for delays and conflicting land classifications. In a separate case, the court addressed Hyderabad's worsening parking crisis, blaming builders for constructing additional flats without adequate parking, exacerbating traffic congestion. The court has adjourned both matters for further hearing.

news.title: Sukhpal Ahluwalia buys 11,000 sq ft apartment in DLF's Camellias for ₹100 crore
news.para: British businessman Sukhpal Singh Ahluwalia has purchased a luxurious 11,416 sq ft apartment in DLF's The Camellias, Gurugram, for Rs 100 crore, marking the third such high-value transaction in the complex. This deal highlights the continued strong demand for luxury homes in India, with prices in Gurugram and Delhi now rivalling Mumbai's upscale areas.

news.title: Bill passed in Karnataka to regularise 15% building violations
news.para: Karnataka's assembly passed a bill allowing municipal commissioners to regularize unlawful buildings with penalties, reminiscent of the stalled Akrama-Sakrama scheme. The amendment, applicable to buildings meeting existing bylaws, raises permissible building plan violations to 15%. It also empowers empanelled professionals to sanction plans and shifts plan approval authority to ULB commissioners for faster processing.

news.title: Delhi: MCD & NDMC propose reforms to simplify property tax assessment
news.para: To streamline property tax assessment and minimize citizen harassment, both MCD and NDMC are advocating for reforms under the Jan Vishwas Bill 2025. NDMC proposes adopting the unit area method for tax calculation, while MCD seeks to limit tax assessments to seven years and mandate physical surveys for initial assessments.

news.title: NGT notice to builder, Haryana government over illegal construction in Aravalis
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has issued notices concerning alleged illegal construction by a real estate firm abutting the Wazirabad forest in Gurugram's Sector 54. The project, reportedly lacking necessary environmental clearances, faces scrutiny over potential damage to the Aravali hills.

news.title: Weaver Services to raise ₹1,482 crore from Lightspeed, Premji Invest
news.para: Weaver Services, a tech-led housing finance platform, is raising Rs 1,481.5 crore in funding led by Lightspeed and Premji Invest. Focused on affordable housing, Weaver targets self-employed individuals in smaller cities. The funds will support asset acquisitions, tech development, and expansion. Weaver uses AI to improve loan approvals and credit assessment.

news.title: Housing finance companies struggle as mortgage rate war intensifies
news.para: Housing finance companies are grappling with squeezed margins due to aggressive mortgage rate pricing by public sector banks. Despite increased loan disbursals, AUM growth remains sluggish as borrowers switch to competitors offering lower rates. This intense competition and rate war are expected to persist, impacting even major players like LIC Housing Finance and Bajaj Housing Finance.

news.title: Jaipur development body goes online with lease process
news.para: The Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) has fully digitized its lease and lease deed issuance process, eliminating the need for in-person visits. Citizens can now complete the entire procedure online, from application to lease issuance, with Aadhaar-based e-KYC and digital signatures.

news.title: Over 7.5 acres in heart of Hyderabad to be auctioned today; ₹500 crore expected from sale
news.para: The Telangana Housing Board is set to auction over 7.5 acres of prime residential land in Kukatpally, expecting to generate ₹500 crore. Alongside, 618 unfinished 3BHK flats in Pocharam and Gajularamaram will also be auctioned. Funds raised will support affordable housing projects and the Indiramma housing scheme, building on recent successful auctions.

news.title: With FIRs, Noida authority plans crackdown on illegal constructions
news.para: Noida Authority is cracking down on illegal constructions by directing officials to file FIRs and pursue pending police cases. A consolidated database will monitor enforcement efforts, ensuring accountability and preventing delays. The Authority will also enhance public awareness with updated signage and focus on preventing encroachments in flood-prone areas, coordinating with various departments for effective action.

news.title: Housing finance companies under lens over lending faults
news.para: The National Housing Bank is intensifying its scrutiny of housing finance companies due to breaches in loan-to-value regulations, particularly for high-value home loans exceeding ₹75 lakh. Lenders are found to be disbursing loans up to 90% LTV, violating the stipulated 75% cap.

news.title: Prayagraj: 9,000 PMAY beneficiaries claim ₹1.2 lakh subsidy each by posing as homeless
news.para: A massive fraud has been uncovered in Prayagraj, where over 9,000 individuals falsely claimed housing subsidies under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana, despite already owning homes. Investigations also revealed pension fraud across various government schemes, resulting in a loss of Rs 40 lakh due to fake claims and unreported deaths.

news.title: Consumer forum holds Parsvanath Developers liable for delay in handing over flat
news.para: Parsvanath Developers Limited has been held liable by the Delhi State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission for delaying possession of a residential flat booked in 2007. The commission directed the builder to hand over the flat and pay Rs 5.5 lakh in compensation to the complainants, Nitin and Amita Bansal, citing deficiency in service and unfair trade practices.
